00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * interface to the serial port UART hardware
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 106907 $<hr>
00046  *
00047  */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_UART_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_UART_H__
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #define CVMX_UART_NUM_PORTS     2
00059 #define CVMX_UART_TX_FIFO_SIZE  64
00060 #define CVMX_UART_RX_FIFO_SIZE  64
00061 
00062 /* CSR typedefs have been moved to cvmx-uart-defs.h */
00063 
00064 typedef void (*cvmx_uart_intr_handler_t) (int, uint64_t[]);
00065 
00066 extern void cvmx_uart_enable_intr(int, cvmx_uart_intr_handler_t);
00067 extern void cvmx_uart_unmask_intr_on_core(int, int);
00068 extern void cvmx_uart_mask_intr_on_core(int, int);
00069 extern int cvmx_uart_setup2(int, int, int);
00070 extern int cvmx_uart_setup(int);
00071 
00072 /* Defined in libc.  */
00073 unsigned __octeon_uart_trylock(void);
00074 void __octeon_uart_unlock(void);
00075 
00076 /**
00077  * Get a single byte from serial port.
00078  *
00079  * @param uart_index Uart to read from (0 or 1)
00080  * @return The byte read
00081  */
00082 static inline uint8_t cvmx_uart_read_byte(int uart_index)
00083 {
00084     cvmx_uart_lsr_t lsrval;
00085 
00086     /* Spin until data is available */
00087     do {
00088         lsrval.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_MIO_UARTX_LSR(uart_index));
00089     } while (!lsrval.s.dr);
00090 
00091     /* Read and return the data */
00092     return cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_MIO_UARTX_RBR(uart_index));
00093 }
00094 
00095 /**
00096  * Get a single byte from serial port with a timeout.
00097  *     
00098  * @param uart_index Uart to read from (0 or 1)
00099  * @param timedout Record if a timeout has happened
00100  * @param timeout the timeout count
00101  * @return The byte read
00102  */
00103 static inline uint8_t cvmx_uart_read_byte_with_timeout(int uart_index, int *timedout, volatile unsigned timeout)
00104 {
00105     cvmx_uart_lsr_t lsrval;
00106 
00107     /* Spin until data is available */
00108     *timedout = 0;
00109     do {
00110         if (timeout == 0) {
00111             *timedout = 1;
00112             return -1;
00113         }
00114         lsrval.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_MIO_UARTX_LSR(uart_index));
00115         timeout--;
00116     } while (!lsrval.s.dr);
00117 
00118     /* Read and return the data */
00119     return cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_MIO_UARTX_RBR(uart_index));
00120 }
00121 
00122 /**
00123  * Put a single byte to uart port.
00124  *
00125  * @param uart_index Uart to write to (0 or 1)
00126  * @param ch         Byte to write
00127  */
00128 static inline void cvmx_uart_write_byte(int uart_index, uint8_t ch)
00129 {
00130     cvmx_uart_lsr_t lsrval;
00131 
00132     /* Spin until there is room */
00133     do {
00134         lsrval.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_MIO_UARTX_LSR(uart_index));
00135     }
00136     while (lsrval.s.thre == 0);
00137 
00138     /* Write the byte */
00139     cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_MIO_UARTX_THR(uart_index), ch);
00140 }
00141 
00142 /**
00143  * Write a string to the uart
00144  *
00145  * @param uart_index Uart to use (0 or 1)
00146  * @param str        String to write
00147  */
00148 static inline void cvmx_uart_write_string(int uart_index, const char *str)
00149 {
00150     /* Just loop writing one byte at a time */
00151     while (*str) {
00152         cvmx_uart_write_byte(uart_index, *str);
00153         str++;
00154     }
00155 }

00159 }

00161 #endif
00162 
00163 #endif /*  __CVM_UART_H__ */
